Reviews.Title: Limited compatibility with TrendNet IP cameras
Reviews.Author: Lebon G. Abercrombie
Reviews.Content: This unit works OK with older TrendNet IP cameras, but is not compatible with their newer cameras using 802.11N wireless and/or newer web server firmware, such as the TV-IP512WM.  According to their support people, there is no plan to upgrade the TV-M7 for comatibiity.Also, it does not appear to be able to control the camera steering on a camera such as the TV-IP422W.Altogether, a disappointing purchase.

Reviews.Title: Lacks sound support
Reviews.Author: Marcelo W. De Brisac
Reviews.Content: Even though the picture frame is sound capable (for movies), the camera monitor does not reproduce audio form the cameras. I have Trendnet sound enabled cameras and was shocked to find out this monitor could not reproduce the camera's audio.

Reviews.Title: TrendNet TV-M7 doesn't allow camera audio to play
Reviews.Author: GregGarner
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV-M7 monitor to allow me to watch and listen to our handicapped son in his bedroom at night. Unfortunately, the TV-M7 software will not do audio when it is connected to a Trendnet camera with audio.  It does display the video fine.  I also found that the TV-M7 was very picky about WIFI setup and it would only work on my older WEP access point. I could not get it to work on WPA.  The Trendnet camera worked fine on WPA, and the PC application would allow me to listen to audio from the TrendNet TV-IP422W camera.  To be fair, when I carefully re-read the marketing literature and the user manual, it did not mention that it would do audio when connected to a camera. I just assumed since the display had audio ability that TrendNet would have enabled this functionality.The Display also would not allow you to pan or tilt the camera.
